heading: Deaths
txt: William Halford, English-American lieutenant, Medal of Honor recipient (b. 1841)

entities.title: William Halford
entities.description: William Halford was a sailor, and later an officer, in the United States Navy. He also received the Medal of Honor.

entities.title: Medal of Honor
entities.description: The Medal of Honor (MOH) is the United States government's highest and most prestigious military decoration that may be awarded to recognize American soldiers, sailors, marines, airmen, Space Force guardians, and coast guardsmen who have distinguished themselves by acts of valor. The medal is normally awarded by the President of the United States, but as it is presented "in the name of the United

heading: Deaths
txt: Alexander Kolchak, Russian admiral and explorer (b. 1874)

entities.title: Alexander Kolchak
entities.description: Alexander Vasilyevich Kolchak was an Imperial Russian admiral, military leader and polar explorer who served in the Imperial Russian Navy and fought in the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-1905 and the First World War. heading: Deaths
txt: John J. Gardner, American politician (b. 1845)

entities.title: John J. Gardner
entities.description: John James Gardner was an American Republican Party politician who represented New Jersey's 2nd congressional district in the United States House of Representatives for five terms from 1893 to 1913, and was Mayor of Atlantic City, New Jersey.

heading: Deaths
txt: Elihu Root, American lawyer and politician, 38th United States Secretary of State, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1845)

entities.title: Elihu Root
entities.description: Elihu Root was an American lawyer and statesman who served as Secretary of State under President Theodore Roosevelt and as Secretary of War under Roosevelt and President William McKinley. He moved frequently between high-level appointed government positions in Washington, D.C. and private-sector legal practice in New York City. For that reason, he is sometimes considered to be the prototype of the

entities.title: United States Secretary of State
entities.description: The United States secretary of state implements foreign policy for the U.S. government as the head of the U.S. Department of State. Created in 1789, the Cabinet position is analogous to a foreign minister in other countries.

entities.title: Nobel Peace Prize
entities.description: The Nobel Peace Prize is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Swedish industrialist, inventor, and armaments manufacturer Alfred Nobel, along with the prizes in Chemistry, Physics, Physiology or Medicine, and Literature. Since March 1901, it has been awarded annually to those who have "done the most or the best work for fraternity between nations, for the abolition or reduction

heading: Deaths
txt: Harvey Samuel Firestone, American businessman, founded the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company (b. 1868)

entities.title: Harvey Samuel Firestone
entities.description: Harvey Samuel Firestone was an American businessman, and the founder of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, one of the first global makers of automobile tires.

entities.title: Firestone Tire and Rubber Company
entities.description: Firestone Tire and Rubber Company is an American tire company founded by Harvey Firestone in 1900 initially to supply solid rubber side-wire tires for fire apparatus, and later, pneumatic tires for wagons, buggies, and other forms of wheeled transportation common in the era. Firestone soon saw the huge potential for marketing tires for automobiles, and the company was a pioneer in the mass product

heading: Deaths
txt: Boris Grigoriev, Russian painter and illustrator (b. 1886)

entities.title: Boris Grigoriev
entities.description: Boris Grigoriev was a Russian painter, graphic artist, and author.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ivan Bilibin, Russian illustrator and stage designer (b. 1876)

entities.title: Ivan Bilibin
entities.description: Ivan Yakovlevich Bilibin was a Russian illustrator and stage designer who took part in the Mir iskusstva, contributed to the Ballets Russes, co-founded the Union of Russian Artists and from 1937 was a member of the Artists' Union of the USSR. heading: Deaths
txt: Lina Cavalieri, Italian soprano and actress (b. 1874)

entities.title: Lina Cavalieri
entities.description: Natalina "Lina" Cavalieri was an Italian operatic soprano, actress, and monologist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Nap Lajoie, American baseball player and manager (b. 1874)

entities.title: Nap Lajoie
entities.description: Napoleon Lajoie, also known as Larry Lajoie and nicknamed "The Frenchman", was an American professional baseball second baseman and player-manager. He played in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the Philadelphia Phillies, Philadelphia Athletics (twice), and Cleveland Naps between 1896 and 1916. He managed the Naps from 1905 through 1909.

heading: Deaths
txt: Daniel François Malan, South African minister and politician, 5th Prime Minister of South Africa (b. 1874)

entities.description: The prime minister of South Africa was the head of government in South Africa between 1910 and 1984.

txt: Igor Kurchatov, Russian physicist and academic (b. 1903)

entities.title: Igor Kurchatov
entities.description: Igor Vasilyevich Kurchatov, was a Soviet nuclear physicist who is widely known as the director of the Soviet atomic bomb project. heading: Deaths
txt: Learco Guerra, Italian cyclist and manager (b. 1902)

entities.title: Learco Guerra
entities.description: Learco Guerra was an Italian professional road racing cyclist. The highlight of his career was his overall win in the 1934 Giro d'Italia. He was born in San Nicolò Po, a frazione of Bagnolo San Vito in Lombardy, gained the nickname of "Human Locomotive" for his enduring quality in plain stages. After mediocre attempts to play football, Guerra became a professional cyclist in 1928, at 26. The follo

heading: Deaths
txt: Sofoklis Venizelos, Greek captain and politician, 133rd Prime Minister of Greece (b. 1894)

entities.title: Sofoklis Venizelos
entities.description: Sofoklis Venizelos was a Greek politician, who three times served as Prime Minister of Greece – in 1944, 1950 and 1950–1951.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Greece
entities.description: The prime minister of the Hellenic Republic, colloquially referred to as the prime minister of Greece, is the head of government of the Hellenic Republic and the leader of the Greek Cabinet. The incumbent prime minister is Kyriakos Mitsotakis, who took office on 8 July 2019.

heading: Deaths
txt: Nick Adams, American actor and screenwriter (b. 1931)

entities.title: Nick Adams (actor, born 1931)
entities.description: Nick Adams was an American film and television actor and screenwriter. He was noted for his roles in several Hollywood films during the 1950s and 1960s along with his starring role in the ABC television series The Rebel (1959). heading: Deaths
txt: Walter Lang, American director and screenwriter (b. 1896)

entities.title: Walter Lang
entities.description: Walter Lang was an American film director.

heading: Deaths
txt: Josef Mengele, German SS officer and physician (b. 1911)

entities.title: Josef Mengele
entities.description: Josef Mengele, also known as the Angel of Death was a German Schutzstaffel (SS) officer and physician during World War II. He is mainly remembered for his actions at the Auschwitz concentration camp, where he performed deadly experiments on prisoners, and was a member of the team of doctors who selected victims to be killed in the gas chambers and was one of the doctors who administered the gas. W

entities.title: SS
entities.description: The Schutzstaffel was a major paramilitary organization under Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party in Nazi Germany, and later throughout German-occupied Europe during World War II. It began with a small guard unit known as the Saal-Schutz made up of party volunteers to provide security for party meetings in Munich. heading: Deaths
txt: Cheikh Anta Diop, Senegalese historian, anthropologist, and physicist (b. 1923)

entities.title: Cheikh Anta Diop
entities.description: Cheikh Anta Diop was a Senegalese historian, anthropologist, physicist, and politician who studied the human race's origins and pre-colonial African culture. Though Diop is sometimes referred to as an Afrocentrist, he predates the concept and thus was not himself an Afrocentric scholar. heading: Deaths
txt: Alan Perlis, American computer scientist and academic (b. 1922)

entities.title: Alan Perlis
entities.description: Alan Jay Perlis was an American computer scientist and professor at Purdue University, Carnegie Mellon University and Yale University. He is best known for his pioneering work in programming languages and was the first recipient of the Turing Award.

heading: Deaths
txt: Amos Yarkoni, Israeli colonel (b. 1920)

entities.title: Amos Yarkoni
entities.description: Sgan aluf Amos Yarkoni, was an officer in the Israel Defense Forces and one of six Israeli Arabs to have received the IDF's third highest decoration, the Medal of Distinguished Service. He was the first commander of the Shaked Reconnaissance Battalion of Israel's Southern command.

heading: Deaths
txt: Witold Lutosławski, Polish composer and conductor (b. 1913)

entities.title: Witold Lutosławski
entities.description: Witold Roman Lutosławski was a Polish composer and conductor. He was one of the major European composers of the 20th century, and "generally regarded as the most significant Polish composer since Szymanowski, and possibly the greatest Polish composer since Chopin". heading: Deaths
txt: King Hussein of Jordan (b. 1935)

entities.title: Hussein of Jordan
entities.description: Hussein bin Talal was King of Jordan from 11 August 1952 until his death in 1999. As a member of the Hashemite dynasty, the royal family of Jordan since 1921, Hussein was a 40th-generation direct descendant of Muhammad.

entities.description: Douglas James Henning was a Canadian magician, illusionist, escape artist and politician.

txt: Anne Morrow Lindbergh, American author and pilot (b. 1906)

entities.title: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
entities.description: Anne Spencer Morrow Lindbergh was an American author and aviator. She was the wife of decorated pioneer aviator Charles Lindbergh, with whom she made many exploratory flights.

heading: Deaths
txt: Augusto Monterroso, Guatemalan author (b. 1921)

entities.title: Augusto Monterroso

heading: Deaths

entities.title: Atli Dam
entities.description: Atli Pætursson Dam was a Faroese politician who served as Prime Minister of the Faroe Islands on three occasions, most recently from 1991 to 1993. To this date, he is the longest-serving Prime Minister in Faroese history, having served a total of 16 years.

entities.title: Prime Minister of the Faroe Islands

entities.description: Margrethe Blossom Dearie was an American jazz singer and pianist. She had a recognizably light and girlish voice. Dearie performed regular engagements in London and New York City over many years and collaborated with many musicians, including Johnny Mercer, Miles Davis, Jack Segal, Johnny Mandel, Duncan Lamont, Bob Dorough, Dave Frishberg, and Jay Berliner.

entities.description: Krsto Papić was a Croatian screenwriter and film director whose career spanned over five decades. He is generally considered among the best directors of former Yugoslavia and the only director from Croatia that can be counted among the Yugoslav Black Wave.

txt: Doug Mohns, Canadian-American ice hockey player (b. 1933)

entities.title: John Dingell
entities.description: John David Dingell Jr. was an American politician who served as a member of the United States House of Representatives from 1955 until 2015. A member of the Democratic Party, he holds the record for longest-serving member of Congress in American history, representing Michigan for more than 59 years.
